description: Borrowed from Latin adductio, adductionis, from adducō (“I bring to myself”), from ad + ducō (“I lead”). Compare French adduction. See adduce.

entries.meaning: The act of adducing or bringing forward.
examples: an adduction of facts gathered from various quarters

entries.meaning: (anatomy) The action by which the parts of the body are drawn towards its axis; -- opposed to abduction.
